column3: This is still inaccurate. Rescans don't work. This is true whether they're manually initiated via the rescan flag or as part of one of those RPCs. I realize the intent is to make it clear that those commands are still possible sans rescan, but it goes too far and now doesn't indicate that a standalone rescan won't work.\n

IMO the current release notes (without this PR) is okay. Unless we have a rescan-down-to-height feature (which we don't have in 0.12), rescans don't work with pruning (current rescans always start at genesis).\nTend to NACK.\n

I don't think this change is correct either. `-rescan` doesn't work with pruning, period. RPC calls such as import will work without rescan, though.

I'm sure that could be worded better, though.

But there's a limit on how much time we should spend on polishing release notes on a release that's already "history". Let's try to have the next releases's release notes ready in time for the next r

Agreed

I'm not sure this is more clear. Cookie authentication is only used when no `-rpcpassword` is specified, it's not suddenly used in previous setups.\n
ok I derped. Someone else had tested this(incorrectly?) on IRC and I remembered wrong. It's rpcauth which is tried after cookie auth.\n
